sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: A man in his 50s has died in Switzerland after a violent storm swept through the town of La Chaux-de-Fond on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Around 15 people are also being treated for injuries by emergency services, according to police.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The storm did not last long, but the strong gusts of wind caused significant damage, reaching speeds of 217 kilometres an hour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: In its wake is a long line of destruction. Vehicles destroyed, roofs torn off, street furniture scattered on streets and dozens of trees uprooted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Rescue and clearing operations are continuing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Swiss police are also appealing to the public not to put themselves at risk, especially in woodland areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The Chaux-de-Fonds sits near the French border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And before reaching Switzerland, the storm hit eastern France, particularly the Dube de Parlement, around midday Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: There around 30 homes were affected, although the extent of the damage is unknown at this stage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Other cities were also hit by heavy rain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And in the Italian province of Monza and Brianza, a woman was crushed to death by a large tree that suddenly fell on her.
